newsitem.title: UK: They're chasing mice at Buckingham Palace.
newsitem.headline: They're chasing mice at Buckingham Palace.

text.p: Hordes of mice have invaded the kitchens and servant quarters at Queen Elizabeth's Buckingham Palace.
A Palace spokeswoman on Wednesday confirmed news reports that notices had been pinned up in kitchens and residential areas used by staff telling them to clear away food.
But she said the kitchens where food is prepared for the queen and her husband Prince Philip had not been affected.
"Buckingham Palace is an old and very large building, and from time to time there is a problem with pests like mice. We take the steps necessary to keep it under control," the spokeswoman said.
Staff have been told to keep food in boxes or jars and to clear out some cupboards so they can be treated with pest control products.
